body:
It looks like there might be some enhanced "don't link to places unless the user really really really really wants it" protection in recent releases of OSX: https://github.com/oracle/node-oracledb/issues/231

Unsure if related

I just built from source on High Sierra with SIP enabled with no issues with Python installed via `brew`. What's your OS version and where do you get your Python distribution from:

```
macOS High Sierra 10.13.4
Python 3.6.5 installed via brew install python3
Darwin 17.5.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.5.0: Fri Apr 13 19:32:32 PDT 2018; root:xnu-4570.51.2~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64


$ git clone https://github.com/grpc/grpc -b v1.12.x
$ python3 -m virtualenv venv
Using base prefix '/Users/mmx/Library/Homebrew/Cellar/python/3.6.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6'
New python executable in /private/var/folders/w2/53c3tgks20158nb09bm3n13m007sfj/T/tmp.h9jWLBOS/venv/bin/python3.6
Also creating executable in /private/var/folders/w2/53c3tgks20158nb09bm3n13m007sfj/T/tmp.h9jWLBOS/venv/bin/python
Installing setuptools, pip, wheel...done.

$ venv/bin/pip install -r grpc/requirements.txt
Collecting coverage>=4.0 (from -r grpc/requirements.txt (line 2))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/a3/7e/c94c21d643bfe7017615994df7b52292a33c8dcf36a6f694af110594edba/coverage-4.5.1-cp36-cp36m-macosx_10_12_x86_64.whl
Collecting cython>=0.27 (from -r grpc/requirements.txt (line 3))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/90/f3/45726cd4e63233043ff4ad3ff25df7a74f52fe90477af240054113af2ccb/Cython-0.28.3-cp36-cp36m-macosx_10_6_intel.macosx_10_9_intel.macosx_10_9_x86_64.macosx_10_10_intel.macosx_10_10_x86_64.whl
Collecting enum34>=1.0.4 (from -r grpc/requirements.txt (line 4))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/af/42/cb9355df32c69b553e72a2e28daee25d1611d2c0d9c272aa1d34204205b2/enum34-1.1.6-py3-none-any.whl
Collecting protobuf>=3.5.0.post1 (from -r grpc/requirements.txt (line 5))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/eb/a7/042722bc48082f6b02498ebdf4e64a6d1b4543271d4f2f495641f429c56d/protobuf-3.5.2.post1-cp36-cp36m-macosx_10_6_intel.macosx_10_9_intel.macosx_10_9_x86_64.macosx_10_10_intel.macosx_10_10_x86_64.whl
Collecting six>=1.10 (from -r grpc/requirements.txt (line 6))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/67/4b/141a581104b1f6397bfa78ac9d43d8ad29a7ca43ea90a2d863fe3056e86a/six-1.11.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Requirement already satisfied: wheel>=0.29 in ./venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from -r grpc/requirements.txt (line 7)) (0.31.1)
Requirement already satisfied: setuptools in ./venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from protobuf>=3.5.0.post1->-r grpc/requirements.txt (line 5)) (39.2.0)
Installing collected packages: coverage, cython, enum34, six, protobuf
Successfully installed coverage-4.5.1 cython-0.28.3 enum34-1.1.6 protobuf-3.5.2.post1 six-1.11.0

$ cd grpc/
$ git submodule update --init
$ GRPC_PYTHON_BUILD_WITH_CYTHON=1 ../venv/bin/pip install .
Processing /private/var/folders/w2/53c3tgks20158nb09bm3n13m007sfj/T/tmp.h9jWLBOS/grpc
Requirement already satisfied: six>=1.5.2 in /private/var/folders/w2/53c3tgks20158nb09bm3n13m007sfj/T/tmp.h9jWLBOS/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from grpcio==1.12.1) (1.11.0)
Building wheels for collected packages: grpcio
  Running setup.py bdist_wheel for grpcio ... done
  Stored in directory: /private/var/folders/w2/53c3tgks20158nb09bm3n13m007sfj/T/pip-ephem-wheel-cache-f5jlsrty/wheels/ea/1b/06/87e6f7de5557b862368554740bcc2828462b0242b16c969e08
Successfully built grpcio
Installing collected packages: grpcio
Successfully installed grpcio-1.12.1
```

high sierra 10.13.4 as well

Python 3.6.4

`Darwin ${REDACTED_MACHINE_NAME} 17.5.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.5.0: Fri Apr 13 19:32:32 PDT 2018; root:xnu-4570.51.2~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64`

Installing it worked just fine. It is only when I tried to run something in that venv that it failed to link some symbols in the cpython library.
Please Try running a grpc service in that venv and let me know if it still works. If it still works in the venv then this can probably be closed as not reproducible.
Just tried it manually and also ran the examples: the greeter example works.
